Title.evidence: Methods: We randomized 507 primary TKAs in 416 eligible patients to receive MB (n = 252) or FB (n = 255) devices

Trial_Design.evidence: We randomized 507 primary TKAs in 416 eligible patients

Intervention.evidence: to receive MB (n = 252) or FB (n = 255) devices

Objective.evidence: We asked whether function of patients or survivorship would be greater or complications would be lesser in groups of patients with MB compared with fixed bearing (FB) TKA.

Method_Outcome.evidence: WOMAC Index, SF-12 Health Survey, knee range of motion, and Knee Society scores were collected and compared preoperatively and at 6, 12, and 24 months postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Patients were blinded to treatment allocation.

Blinding.evidence: Patients were blinded to treatment allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: We randomized 507 primary TKAs in 416 eligible patients to receive MB (n = 252) or FB (n = 255) devices from November 2001 to August 2007

Number_Analysed.evidence: Nineteen of the 252 MB and 13 of the 255 FB knees had undergone revision of any component.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Estimated survival at 6 postoperative years was similar for the two devices: 90.1% (95% confidence interval [CI], 84.1–93.9) for MB and 94.2% (95% CI, 90.1–96.6) for FB.

Harms.evidence: We recorded device failures and complications until October 2009.
